conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict whether it flows into container D or E after passing through baffles.
Liquid A (blue) starts at the top left of the image.
Liquid A flows downward in a straight path.
Liquid A hits the black bar in its path.
Liquid A continues downward, bypassing any obstructions.
Liquid A flows into container D.
Liquid B (yellow) starts at the top center of the image.
Liquid B hits the black bar in its path.
Liquid B divides into two paths: one flows down the yellow bar and into container E, and another may flow further right.
The main flow of Liquid B continues into container E.
Liquid C (pink) starts at the top right of the image.
Liquid C hits the gray bar in its path.
Liquid C flows into container E.
Liquid A flows into container D, and Liquids B and C flow into container E.
